item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec 2025 Results Show Mixed Trends with Mid Caps Leading Growth
item.description: The December 2025 quarterly earnings season has unfolded with a notable improvement in positive results, particularly driven by mid-cap companies. With 420 stocks having declared results, the proportion of companies reporting profit growth has risen to 54.0%, marking a significant uptick compared to previous quarters. This article analyses the key trends, sectoral performances, and standout performers shaping the current earnings landscape. Time: 1 minute ago

item.title: AXISCADES Technologies Ltd Falls 10.26%: 5 Key Factors Behind the Volatile Week
item.description: AXISCADES Technologies Ltd experienced a turbulent week from 19 to 23 January 2026, with its share price declining by 10.26% to close at ₹1,152.80, significantly underperforming the Sensex which fell 3.31% over the same period. The stock endured a prolonged downtrend marked by multiple lower circuit hits before a sharp rebound on the final trading day, reflecting a volatile investor sentiment amid sectoral headwinds and technical shifts. Time: 45 minutes ago

item.title: Winsome Yarns Ltd Falls 0.56% Despite Sector Gains: 5 Key Events Shaping the Week
item.description: Winsome Yarns Ltd closed the week marginally lower by 0.56% at ₹1.79, underperforming the Sensex which fell 3.31% over the same period. The stock faced intense selling pressure midweek, hitting lower circuit limits on three consecutive days before a late surge to the upper circuit on 23 Jan 2026. This volatile price action was driven by a combination of a recent downgrade to a Strong Sell rating, weak fundamentals, and thin liquidity in the micro-cap garment sector stock. Time: 45 minutes ago

item.title: Arihant Superstructures Falls 13.26%: 4 Key Factors Driving the Sharp Decline
item.description: Arihant Superstructures Ltd experienced a challenging week from 19 to 23 January 2026, with its stock price declining sharply by 13.26% to close at Rs.269.55, significantly underperforming the Sensex which fell 3.31% over the same period. The stock hit multiple 52-week lows amid persistent financial pressures, sectoral weakness, and deteriorating technical indicators, reflecting a broad-based bearish sentiment. Time: 45 minutes ago

item.title: Transworld Shipping Lines Ltd’s Volatile Week: -5.57% Amid Sharp Swings and Strong Buying Pressure
item.description: Transworld Shipping Lines Ltd experienced a turbulent week from 19 to 23 January 2026, closing down 5.57% at Rs.157.80 despite a remarkable 19.96% surge on 22 January. The stock underperformed the Sensex, which declined 3.31% over the same period, reflecting persistent financial challenges and volatile investor sentiment amid mixed market signals. Time: 45 minutes ago

item.title: Tanla Platforms Gains 4.03%: 3 Key Factors Driving the Week’s Rally
item.description: Tanla Platforms Ltd closed the week ending 23 January 2026 with a 4.03% gain, outperforming the Sensex which declined 3.31% over the same period. The stock demonstrated resilience amid a broadly negative market backdrop, driven by strong intraday rallies, heightened institutional interest, and continued revenue momentum despite margin pressures. This review analyses the key events shaping Tanla’s price action and market sentiment during the week. Time: 45 minutes ago

item.title: National Aluminium Gains 2.48%: 2 Key Factors Driving This Week’s Momentum
item.description: National Aluminium Company Ltd (NACL) recorded a resilient week, closing at Rs.370.45 on 23 Jan 2026, up 2.48% from the previous Friday’s close of Rs.361.50. This performance notably outpaced the Sensex, which declined 3.31% over the same period, underscoring NACL’s relative strength amid broader market weakness. The week was marked by a new 52-week high and robust trading activity, reflecting strong institutional interest and sustained investor confidence. Time: 45 minutes ago

item.title: Uni Abex Alloy Products Ltd Falls 2.98%: Technical Weakness and Valuation Concerns Shape the Week
item.description: Uni Abex Alloy Products Ltd closed the week at ₹2,988.30, down 2.98% from ₹3,080.15 the previous Friday, slightly outperforming the Sensex which fell 3.31% over the same period. The stock experienced a volatile week marked by a shift from sideways to mildly bearish technical momentum, a downgrade to a Sell rating, and mixed price movements influenced by technical and valuation concerns. Time: 45 minutes ago

item.title: APL Apollo Tubes Gains 3.15%: 5 Key Factors Driving the Week’s Rally
item.description: APL Apollo Tubes Ltd closed the week with a 3.15% gain, rising from Rs.1,939.80 on 16 Jan 2026 to Rs.2,001.00 on 23 Jan 2026, outperforming the Sensex which declined 3.31% over the same period. The stock experienced a volatile week marked by a sharp rebound midweek, a new 52-week and all-time high, and robust derivatives market activity signalling strong investor interest amid mixed broader market conditions. Time: 46 minutes ago

item.title: Bharat Electronics Ltd’s Mixed Week: -0.06% Price Change Amid Derivatives Surge
item.description: Bharat Electronics Ltd (BEL) experienced a largely sideways week ending 23 January 2026, with its share price marginally declining by 0.06% to close at Rs.409.90, outperforming the broader Sensex which fell 3.31% over the same period. The stock showed resilience amid volatile market conditions, buoyed by strong derivatives activity and sectoral rallies, though short-term price fluctuations reflected cautious investor sentiment. Time: 46 minutes ago

item.title: Nirlon Ltd Falls 2.40% This Week: Mixed Technicals and Financials Shape Outlook
item.description: Nirlon Ltd’s share price declined by 2.40% over the week ending 23 January 2026, closing at Rs.489.60 from Rs.501.65 the previous Friday. This underperformance occurred despite the broader Sensex falling more sharply by 3.31%, indicating a relative resilience in Nirlon’s stock amid mixed technical signals and a recent upgrade to a Hold rating by MarketsMOJO. The week was marked by a nuanced shift in technical momentum and a reassessment of the company’s financial and valuation metrics, which together shaped investor sentiment and price action. Time: 46 minutes ago

item.title: Genesys International Falls 9.76% in Volatile Week: Key Price Lows and Rebounds
item.description: Genesys International Corporation Ltd endured a challenging week from 19 to 23 January 2026, with its stock price declining 9.76% to close at Rs.308.95, significantly underperforming the Sensex’s 3.31% fall. The week was marked by a persistent downtrend, punctuated by a sharp intraday rebound on 22 January, but overall the stock remained below key moving averages amid weak quarterly results and elevated interest expenses. Time: 46 minutes ago

item.title: Vintage Coffee & Beverages Ltd Falls 4.36%: 4 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Decline
item.description: Vintage Coffee & Beverages Ltd experienced a challenging week from 19 to 23 January 2026, with its share price declining 4.36% to close at Rs.147.90, slightly underperforming the Sensex which fell 3.31% over the same period. The stock showed notable volatility, including a sharp rebound midweek, but was weighed down by a downgrade to a Hold rating, mixed technical signals, and ongoing concerns about management efficiency and leverage. item.description: AMD Industries Ltd closed the week with a modest gain of 0.30%, outperforming the Sensex which declined 3.31% over the same period. The stock exhibited significant volatility, surging nearly 20% on Monday before retreating steadily through the week amid mixed market sentiment and valuation concerns. Key events including a sharp upper circuit rally and a notable shift in valuation metrics shaped the stock’s trajectory in a challenging broader market environment. Time: 47 minutes ago

item.title: Havells India Declines 9.81%: 5 Key Factors Behind the Sharp Weekly Drop
item.description: Havells India Ltd. experienced a challenging week ending 23 January 2026, with its stock price declining by 9.81% from Rs.1,424.90 to Rs.1,285.15. This underperformance was notably sharper than the Sensex’s 3.31% fall over the same period, reflecting intensified selling pressure amid deteriorating technical indicators, sectoral headwinds, and subdued financial results. The stock hit multiple 52-week lows during the week, signalling sustained downward momentum despite a brief technical upgrade midweek. Time: 47 minutes ago
